tool.name: tool_4
tool.displayname: Get Grid from Virtual Point Cloud

param.name: FILENAME
param.dialogReference:
Filename

File path

The full path and name of the .spcvf file

param.name: GRID_OUT
param.dialogReference:
Grid

Grid list, output, optional

optional

The output grid(s)

param.name: FILEPATH
param.dialogReference:
Optional Output Filepath

File path

The full path to which the output(s) should be written. Leave empty to output the datasets as grid list.

param.name: ATTR_FIELD_GRID
param.dialogReference:
Attribute Field to Grid

Integer

Minimum: 3

Default: 1

The attribute field to grid. Field numbers start with 1, so elevation is attribute field 3.

param.name: CELL_SIZE
param.dialogReference:
Cellsize

Floating point

Minimum: 0.001000

Default: 1.000000

Cellsize of the output grid [map units]

param.name: GRID_SYSTEM_FIT
param.dialogReference:
Grid System Fit

Choice

Available Choices:

[0] nodes

[1] cells

Default: 1

Choose how to align the ouput grid system to the AOI

param.name: METHOD
param.dialogReference:
Aggregation

Choice

Available Choices:

[0] lowest

[1] highest

Default: 1

Choose how to aggregate the values

param.name: CONSTRAIN_QUERY
param.dialogReference:
Constrain Query

Boolean

Default: 0

Check this parameter to constrain the query by an attribute range.

param.name: ATTR_FIELD
param.dialogReference:
Attribute Field

Integer

Minimum: 1

Default: 1

The attribute field to use as constraint. Field numbers start with 1.

param.name: VALUE_RANGE_MIN
param.dialogReference:
Minimum

Floating point

Default: 2.000000

Minimum and maximum of attribute range [].

param.name: VALUE_RANGE_MAX
param.dialogReference:
Maximum

Floating point

Default: 2.000000

Minimum and maximum of attribute range [].

param.name: AOI_SHP
param.dialogReference:
Shape

Shapes, input, optional

optional

Shapefile describing the AOI.

param.name: FIELD_TILENAME
param.dialogReference:
Tilename

Table field

optional

Attribute used for naming the output file(s)

param.name: AOI_GRID
param.dialogReference:
Grid

Grid, input, optional

optional

Grid describing the AOI.

param.name: AOI_XRANGE_MIN
param.dialogReference:
Minimum

Floating point

Default: 0.000000

Minimum and maximum x-coordinate of AOI.

param.name: AOI_XRANGE_MAX
param.dialogReference:
Maximum

Floating point

Default: 0.000000

Minimum and maximum x-coordinate of AOI.

param.name: AOI_YRANGE_MIN
param.dialogReference:
Minimum

Floating point

Default: 0.000000

Minimum and maximum y-coordinate of AOI.

param.name: AOI_YRANGE_MAX
param.dialogReference:
Maximum

Floating point

Default: 0.000000

Minimum and maximum y-coordinate of AOI.

param.name: AOI_ADD_OVERLAP
param.dialogReference:
Add Overlap

Boolean

Default: 0

Add overlap to AOI

param.name: OVERLAP
param.dialogReference:
Overlap

Floating point

Minimum: 0.000000

Default: 50.000000

Overlap [map units]

tool.summary: The tool allows one to retrieve a grid from a virtual point cloud dataset by applying the provided area-of-interest (AOI). The extent of the AOI can be provided either as polygon shapefile, grid or by coordinates. Optionally, an overlap can be added to the AOI. In case an overlap is used and the AOI is provided as polygon shapfile, only the bounding boxes of the polygons are used. With polygon shapefiles additional functionality is available: * in case one or more polygons are selected, only the selected polygons are used. * in case the shapefile contains several polygons a grid dataset is outputted for each polygon. In case the 'Tilename' attribute is provided, the output files are named by this attribute. Otherwise the output file names are build from the lower left coordinate of each tile. The derived datasets can be outputted either as grid list or written to an output directory. For the latter, you must provide a valid file path with the 'Optional Output Filepath' parameter. Optionally, the query can be constrained by providing an attribute field and a value range that must be met. A virtual point cloud dataset is a simple XML format with the file extension .spcvf, which can be created with the 'Create Virtual Point Cloud Dataset' tool.

dataIdInfo.idCredit: Conrad, O., Bechtel, B., Bock, M., Dietrich, H., Fischer, E., Gerlitz, L., Wehberg, J., Wichmann, V., and Boehner, J. (2015): System for Automated Geoscientific Analyses (SAGA) v. 2.1.4, Geosci. Model Dev., 8, 1991-2007, doi:10.5194/gmd-8-1991-2015. [SAGA - System for Automated Geoscientific Analyses - saga-gis.org]
